ActCanada Deposit Insurance Corporation Act
SubjectCompensation Regulations
PrecisCOMPENSATION REGULATIONS in order to (1) preserve financial stability by empowering the Governor in Council and Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation to quickly restore a failed systemically important bank to viability and allow it to remain open and operating, even where the bank has experienced severe losses; (2) reduce government and taxpayer exposure in the unlikely event of a failure of a systemically important bank; and (3) reduce the likelihood of a failure of a systemically important bank and increase market discipline by reinforcing that bank shareholders and creditors are responsible for the bank’s risks—not taxpayers.
